rev.comment: [[WP:NFCC]] #10c requires a rationale for each use. There is no rationale for this use.

{{Cleanup|article|date=March 2008}}

â
[[Image:Braile label.jpg|thumb|right|A braille wine label]]
 
'''Wine labels''' are important sources of information for consumers since they tell the type and origin of the wine. The label is often the only resource a buyer has for evaluating the [[wine]] before purchasing it. Certain information is ordinarily included in the wine label, such as the country of origin, quality, type of wine, alcoholic degree, producer, bottler, or importer.<ref name="Wine Label decoder">George, Rosemary, ''The Simon & Schuster Pocket Wine Label Decoder'', 1989.</ref>
